thread.title: Watch Victor Oladipo sing ‘I Believe I Can Fly’
thread.title_full: Watch Victor Oladipo sing ‘I Believe I Can Fly’

author: USA TODAY
title: Watch Victor Oladipo sing ‘I Believe I Can Fly’
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Watch Victor Oladipo sing ‘I Believe I Can Fly’ He has a beautiful voice. Post to Facebook Watch Victor Oladipo sing ‘I Believe I Can Fly’ He has a beautiful voice. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/victor-oladipo-thunder-i-believe-i-can-fly-sing-song-nba-talent-challenge-all-star-weekend-beautiful-video-watch/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Watch Victor Oladipo sing ‘I Believe I Can Fly’ Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 7:18 p.m. ET Feb. 18, 2017 
Victor Oladipo participated in the NBA Talent Challenge. (Photo: NBA on TNT) 
Victor Oladipo is a fantastic singer. He has prove it in the past, for instance, that time he performed Ain't No Sunshine several years ago. Oladipo has also pretended he has no idea how to sing for a great video with his Thunder teammate Russell Westbrook , who may or may not sing him to sleep some nights . 
Anyway, on Saturday at All-Star Weekend this year, there was an event that aired on TNT called the NBA Talent Challenge. Oladipo was one of the participants, and he sang a beautiful rendition of I Believe I can Fly . . @VicOladipo was soaring high with his take on @rkelly 's "I Believe I Can Fly" #OLADIPOTALENT pic.twitter.com/wtjkawXCsB — NBA on TNT (@NBAonTNT) February 18, 2017 
Oladipo also shared a bit about his singing background: 
"I believe there's a song for everything, so anything that reminds me of a song, I'm gonna sing it on the spot. I'm weird. I sing at the spur of the moment. 
"My sisters growing up, they hated it, I mean, not hated it, but I was really annoying because I sang everywhere. That was the only way I could practice. In the shower, anywhere, I used to sing, and they could hear it, so it was kind of annoying to them. But my mom was like, 'My son can sing, my son can sing,' so she always had my back." 
He humbly added that if people don't think he sounds good he can just say, "Well, I don't know how to sing, I'm a hooper anyway." 
The guy can sing, though. He really can. Read or Share this story: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/victor-oladipo-thunder-i-believe-i-can-fly-sing-song-nba-talent-challenge-all-star-weekend-beautiful-video-watch/ Most Popular
